net.bytebuddy

Class NamingStrategy.SuffixingRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.bytebuddy.NamingStrategy.SuffixingRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamingStrategy
    Enclosing interface:
    NamingStrategy

    public static class NamingStrategy.SuffixingRandom
extends java.lang.Object
implements NamingStrategy
    A naming strategy that creates a internalName by concatenating
    1. The super classes package and internalName
    2. A given suffix string
    3. A random number
    Between all these elements, a $ sign is included into the internalName to improve readability.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.bytebuddy.NamingStrategy

        NamingStrategy.Fixed, NamingStrategy.SuffixingRandom, NamingStrategy.UnnamedType

      SuffixingRandom(java.lang.String suffix)

      SuffixingRandom(java.lang.String suffix, java.lang.String javaLangPackagePrefix)
      Creates an immutable naming strategy with a given suffix but moves types that subclass types within the java.lang package into a given namespace.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName(NamingStrategy.UnnamedType unnamedType)
        Description copied from interface: NamingStrategy
        Generates a fully qualified internalName for a Java type. The resulting should not lie within the java.lang package since such types cannot be loaded using a normal class loader. Also, the internalName should not yet be taken by another type since this would cause conflicts in the internalName space. Therefore, it is recommendable to include a random sequence within the internalName.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface NamingStrategy
        Parameters:
        unnamedType - An unnamed type that is to be named.
        Returns:
        A valid identifier for a Java type.
